channel.title: Need help with "ipban" command please =)
channel.description:
Well i cant actually get a ipban command working for me, ive got a few i looked up, but keep getting the same error:
[code]client.java:11082: cannot find symbol symbol : method appendToBannedIP(java.lang.String) location: class client appendToBannedIP(p.connectedFrom); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error[/code]
Its something to do with that, does anybody know how to fix this, please help, thanks =)

item.title: Need help with "ipban" command please =)
item.dc:creator: @bcdutton bcdutton
item.description:
@bcdutton wrote:

chassy13:

do you have a bannedips text document?

If you read the error, it says missing method. Also even if you didn’t hate the text document, it wouldn’t give off an error.

Maybe this should work, I haven’t tested

[code] public void appendToBannedIP(String player) {

	BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(
				new FileWriter("data/ipbans.txt", true));
		bw.write(player);
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null) {
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				sM("Error with ip banning!");
			}
		}
	}

}[/code]

You would have to change the data/ipbans directory to your right place

Read full topic
